newsitem.title: UK: DIARY - Changes to Worldwide flight schedules.
newsitem.headline: DIARY - Changes to Worldwide flight schedules.

text.p: This is a Reuters diary of changes to worldwide flight schedules.
If you wish to contribute to the diary contact: Air Cargo Newsroom, Tel: +44 171 542 7706 Fax: +44 171 542 5017.
**FEBRUARY 27**
- Air Canada ceases new services from Montreal to Frankfurt and Tel Aviv.
**MARCH 1**
- PamAm begins twice-daily service to Chicago's Midway airport, linking Miami anbd San Juan.
**MARCH 3**
- Burlington Air Express introduces five weekly flights to Guadalajara-Monterrey from Toledo.
**MARCH 5**
- USAir and Deutsche BA adds to new code-share cities, Hamburg and Cologne/Bonn.
**MARCH 6**
- New British airline, Flying Colours, begins operations with a Boeing 757-200 with a flight from Manchester to Lanzarote in the Canary Islands.
**MARCH 8**
- Air Kazakstan starts flying domestic routes.
**MARCH 17**
- British Airways switches 13 weekly flights to Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela to Gatwick's north terminal from Heathrow.
**MARCH 27**
- City hotels launch City Bird long-haul airline, offering flights from Brussels to the Dominican Republic, Cuba, Mexico City and regular service to Miami and Orlando.
**MARCH 29**
- USAir ends code-share agreement with British Airways.
**MARCH 30**
- BA starts flying four time a week to Latvia.
- Air France adds a fifth daily Berlin Tegel to Paris, Charle de Gaulle service.
**MARCH 31**
- Lufthansa starts regular flights between Frankfurt and Perm, Russia via Kazan.
- Air France adds a third regular daily flight between Moscow and Paris.
**MARCH** (UNDATED - END MARCH)
- Singapore Airlines starts a fourth scheduled weekly 747-200 freighter flight between Paris-Charles de Gaulle to Singapore.
**APRIL (UNDATED)
- Dutch Transavia Airlines starts a twice-per-week service to Sri Lanka and the Maldives using a Boeing 757.
**APRIL 1**
- Transaero starts code-sharing programme with American Airlines.
- Air France merges with Air Inter to become Air France Europe.
- KLM starts twice-weekly flights between Amsterdam and Abidjan, Ivory Coast.
- BA inaugurates a weekly all-cargo flight from Pisa's Amerigo Vespucci airport on the Tel Aviv-Pisa-London Gatwick route.
- United Airlines launches a second daily flight linking Chicago O'Hare and London Heathrow until October 25.
- Finnair introduces new route on a trial basis from the south eastern town of Lappeenranta to St. Petersburg.
**APRIL 3**
- South African Airways starts operating a twice-weekly flight from Japan.
- Air New Zealand cease code-share agreement with Qantas.
- Turkish Airlines starts flying a new direct route from Chicago to Instanbul.
- EVA Air launches a major expansion of European service with new flights to Amsterdam and Brussels from Taipei.
**JUNE 1**
- Northwest Airlines starts a service to Delhi and Mumbai.
- Lan Chile to increase flights to Germany by 50 percent to six a week after obtaining two new Frankfurt slots. Current schedule is Frankfurt-Madrid-Santiago four times a week with a Boeing 767-300.
**JUNE 3**
- U.S.' Northwest Airlines starts flights to India, connecting Delhi and Bombay with U.S. destinations through Amsterdam.
**JUNE 15**

- Air Canada and Lufthansa start a code sharing service operated by Air Canada's Boeing 767s between Montreal and Frankfurt consisting of five non-stop flights a week in each direction plus an additional two on the remaining days of the week that will fly via Halifax.
**JUNE 17**
- Air Canada begins non-stop service between Toronto and Osaka.
- United Airlines doubles it flights from the U.S. to Frankfurt to four a day.
**JUNE 19**
- LTU International Airways (German holiday airline) launches weekly services from Dusseldorf to Bergen and Lakselv in Norway.
**JUNE 29**
- Air China starts flights from Beijing and Shanghai to Los Angeles.
**OCTOBER**
- Swissair begins scheduled services to Vietnam with twice-weekly flights to Ho Chi Minh City, the former Saigon.
**OCTOBER 25**
- United Airlines ceases second daily flight between Chicago O'Hare and London Heathrow.
**OCTOBER 26**
- United Airlines starts daily nonstop flights between Chicago and Sao Paulo, Brazil.
